definition: to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: The hecklers were banished from the courtroom.
That meant political troublemakers who did not have a lot of support.
sentences.chinese: 其意思是少有支持者的政坛捣乱分子。

sentences.english: Maybe your child mucks up only at school.
sentences.chinese: 也许你的孩子只是在学校里捣乱。

sentences.english: In the class that day was an obstreperous man who was creating turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 那天教室里有个任性的男人在捣乱。

sentences.english: Watch Ricky.He sometimes likes to act up in class.
sentences.chinese: 注意里基，他有时喜欢在课堂上捣乱。

sentences.english: Monica know is in trouble imelda, want to give her back to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 莫尼卡晓得是伊梅尔达在背后捣乱，想向她妥协。

sentences.english: What it needs is cheap labor and factories, and no one to rock the boat.
sentences.chinese: 它所需要的是廉价劳动力和工厂，并且没有人来捣乱。
那些捣乱分子被赶了出去。

sentences.english: My little brother often makes trouble in my study.
sentences.chinese: 我的小弟第常在我的书房捣乱。

sentences.english: See the sisters with Mao to make trouble, very impatient.
sentences.chinese: 皓月见毛氏姐妹跟来捣乱，非常不耐烦。

sentences.english: Mr.Franco simply tackles all the offenders, including his co-host.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰科先生负责打击所有的捣乱分子，包括他的搭档。

sentences.english: Trick-or-treat is a custom for children on Halloween.
sentences.chinese: 万圣夜孩子们的主要活动是“不给糖就捣乱”。

sentences.english: The police yanked the offenders off to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 警察将捣乱分子揪到警察局里去了。

sentences.english: Many trolls will back down if you reply personally to them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你亲自回复他们，许多网上捣乱者将会消失。

sentences.english: They bounced the troublemakers out of the club.
sentences.chinese: 他们把捣乱分子撵出了俱乐部。

sentences.english: Ascend the wave son to strictly forbid in to cause disturbance wildly for the and calumniate without restraint.
sentences.chinese: 对于骄狂登徒浪子严禁进入捣乱和肆意诽谤。

definition: to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
